text: Hey team, happy Monday! Has anyone managed to build functionality for social sign-in/up for forms? (e.g. below). Feeling a little limited

Pretty sure you cant unless you pay for the Enterprise solution. There are other alternatives, like handling the user system externally. I mean, if it’s really basic you can just use something like auth0
any suggestions for user handling?
i am interested in that topic as well
It really depends on what functionality you need
basic user administration for internal area
password protected
not a lot of different access levels, just basic stuff

Enterprise solution?

Also being asked around password protected areas for preference centre purposes. So there are multiple use cases here.

Quite surprised that the last mention of this on the community board is back in 2017
Password protected areas are supported for pages I believe (shared password). but if you want individual users/registraion you need to pay for Enterprise
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cms-pages-editor/control-audience-access-to-pages>
“Marketing Hub Enteprise|”
or shared password: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-pages-editor/how-can-i-password-protect-my-pages>
Ah, sorry thought you were describing enterprise for the social sign ups. I believe all my instances are enterprise, so should have the ability to setup gated areas.
Hey guys! Wondering, what is the best workflow to fully redesign a header and its nav (or a footer or any global group) without affecting the current one that is live on the website?

Hi Eneline,

Myself l usually clone the global group and also clone the menu that is being used on the live pages. 

In that way l can work on my development template and see how it comes.

When it is ready to go live you will simply put the changes in the existing global group


Hopefully it helps
Hi <@URQV7LU79>. Thanks for your help :+1: That’s the way we had in mind, but I was wondering if there was a better way to do it without cloning the elements.
Ooh great, anyway lets check if there is any other better way from the smart folks in the channel. You are welcome <@U4F0XJWGM>

<@U54TVT3C1> Would you be able to provide more specifics so I can further help investigate this issue? Maybe an example of the HTML you’re copy/pasting and the page you’re editing (this way I can check if the issue is portal specific or not).
Hey <@UN0NUBU3S> let me see if it’s still happening
one second
<@URQV7LU79> how do u deal with the css changes? do you clone your global css file too?
So, the problem is still there when I paste this in

clone a template, clone the global module.  create new page with the aforementioned clones, add a class to new module that you can target that wont affect the original or start a css file specific to the global group
<@U4F0XJWGM> l think <@UD53A9UUR> answered it all. Use a unique class on the development/cloned template and keep on using the global css file but with the unique body class that you have added
if possible, add the class to the group or module.  that way you dont have to add that class to every template upon which you use the new global group
got it! Thank you both!

Happy Monday <!channel>! (sorry for the pings, we don’t really like to use the at channel feature, but we have an extra special request for this week). *Don’t worry, we won’t at channel you again!* 

*Can you take 5 minutes to complete a survey about this Slack?* We want to use your responses to help make this Slack the best it can possibly be in 2020. :developers-developers-developers:

The survey will be open until EOD Friday the 20th. Help us make the :sprocket: HubSpot Developer Slack your favorite online community!
Filling this survey out for you right this moment <@U2H3TT8F2>.  All about giving feedback.
I just filled it out! :slightly_smiling_face:
Awesome, thank you Kevin! Can’t wait to hear the feedback!
We really do :heart: you all for taking the time to fill this out and for all you do :slightly_smiling_face:
done!
i am just going to look at ron swanson  being proud of me for a while
<@U2H3TT8F2> I am working on filling that out here in a second

Great, thank you for the example markup. I can reproduce this as well. The issue has to do with the editor schema in that it thinks the `div` is _empty_ because none of it’s children html elements have content, so it therefore pads it with an `&nbsp;` .

I will discuss with our team to try to find the best solution here for you, and/or think of a valid workaround.
Thanks Isaiah! It’s much appreciated :slightly_smiling_face:

Is this currently blocking you from publishing your pages? If you simply add an `&nbsp;` to each `<i>` tag, the markup persists. Not sure if this will negatively effect how these icons are showing in the div however (depending on your CSS classes)
Also, I hope everything is going well with you!
consider that puppy filled out
i just was told that my email is not valid... i send it with another address, but surveymonkey should really solve this...thats annoying...
Ill reach out to them, I would love them to solve that as well. I dont understand why they havent account for vanity urls that are longer than 6 chars
its a ".marketing" domain btw... if  they ask
<@U2H3TT8F2> your gif skills are :fire:
Done <@U2H3TT8F2>
<https://gph.is/1WE5FeB>

Update: <@U54TVT3C1> we will be working to update the editor schema such that it doesn’t replace the empty nested children of `div` ’s with `&nbsp;`. Only if the `div` has no children will it receive padding.

I will notify you once this change is out in production. In the meantime, the above workaround I proposed should hopefully suffice to retain that markup.
Thanks <@UN0NUBU3S> that’s great news
All is well! Thanks, I hope all is well with you too. :smiley:
Hi all. Is there any way to block submit default action of a form inside onSubmitForm function?. Thanks

not as far as I'm aware. You can customize the redirect/add extra scripts to be run on submission, but I don't think you can stop the submission of the form itself to the CRM database.

You _could_ replace their submit button with one of your own, then submit the form your own way theoretically, but that could get messy.

Also could look at the form submit JS API if you want ultimate control to build your own HTML form
<@UHLMD268G> maybe if you provide what you want to acheive you can get a better response
have you tried targeting it with javascript and preventDefault()?

<@U26BLKGE4>

Tried it and works (sample code is for a single form submit button)

let elem = document.querySelector("input[type='submit']")
elem.addEventListener('click',(e)=>{e.preventDefault()});
<@UF88QJ5RC> I'd doublecheck in the CRM though, I think that data still gets passed through, that's my understanding of the documentation anyway

<@U26BLKGE4> for sure definitely double check. This was a quick and dirty way to address things. The form didn't validate let alone go to the next action (email or otherwise) so my assumption was that the data wasn't being passed. :man-shrugging:
Thank you for your help. I wanted to send a form condittionaly to the length of a textarea.
I get it with this code inside form create method
but i have the problem that my form lose all the theme´s styles
ok, i get my styles again using *css* property inside create method :slightly_smiling_face:
